snippet: A new United Nations report accuses the government of President Bashar al-Assad of “inhuman actions” against Syrian civilians.
abstract: Syrian government forces supported by heavy Russian airstrikes bombard area around Aleppo, overwhelming rebels and sending civilians streaming towards border with Turkey; Syrian opposition is baffled by reluctance of United States and Western allies to counter situation; United Nations accuses Bashar al-Assad regime of atrocities against civilians.

byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Karam Shoumali from Kilis, Alison Smale from Berlin, Nick Cumming-Bruce from Geneva, and Ceylan Yeginsu from Izmir, Turkey.

lead_paragraph: A new United Nations report accuses the government of President Bashar al-Assad of “inhuman actions” against Syrian civilians.

headline.main: Syrians Desperate to Escape What U.N. Calls ‘Extermination’ by Government
headline.print_headline: Syrians Flock to Border as U.N. Report Assails ‘Inhuman Actions’
